data: TM Hepatitis B Immune Globulin IV (HbIG Liver Transplant)  Pre / Post Operative (Multiphase)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Nurse to Initiate the Pre Operative phase of this plan on the day of surgery
Blood Products
Blood Product Fact Sheet
Indications for IV formulation HbIG:  - Recipient has prior Hepatitis B  - Recipient has active Hepatitis B  - Recipient has a history of Hepatitis Delta (HDV)  - Donor has active Hepatitis B
Administer - Hepatitis B Immune Globulin IV
Timed, Administer: 10 mL, IV, Administer over: Refer to Fact Sheet/Product Monograph, once, Maximum rate 2 mL per minute, T;N
Communication Orders
Communication Order

If the patient exhibits signs or symptoms of a Transfusion Reaction, Print Transfusion Reaction Form from FormFast and follow your transfusion reaction guideline.  Notify provider of the transfusion reaction to obtain further care instructions
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
ICU Provider to Initiate the Post Operative phase of this PowerPlan when patient arrives in ICU
Nurse to Discontinue Order Set/Phase
RN to discontinue the Pre Operative Transfusion phase of this plan
Blood Products
Blood Product Fact Sheet
Indications for IV formulation HbIG:  - Recipient has prior Hepatitis B  - Recipient has active Hepatitis B  - Recipient has a history of Hepatitis Delta (HDV)  - Donor has active Hepatitis B
Administer - Hepatitis B Immune Globulin IV
Routine, Administer: 10 mL, IV, Administer over: Refer to Fact Sheet/Product Monograph, qdaily, Maximum rate 2 mL per minute, T;N
Administer - Hepatitis B Immune Globulin IV
Routine, Administer: 10 mL, IV, Administer over: Refer to Fact Sheet/Product Monograph, qMonThur, Maximum rate 2 mL per minute, T;N
Communication Orders
Conditional Order - One Time
If/when Target Hepatitis B Surface Antibody Titre is greater than 1000 milliunits/mL, then Notify provider to discontinue Administer - Hepatitis B Immune Globulin IV daily order
Communication Order

If the patient exhibits signs or symptoms of a Transfusion Reaction, Print Transfusion Reaction Form from FormFast and follow your transfusion reaction guideline.  Notify provider of the transfusion reaction to obtain further care instructions
